# awsappstream_directory_config (Data Source)

Reads an AppStream directory config. This data source can be used to reference an existing AppStream directory configuration that is managed outside of Terraform.

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "awsappstream_directory_config" "example" {
  directory_name = "corp.example.com"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `directory_name` (String) The fully qualified domain name of the Microsoft Active Directory (for example, `corp.example.com`).

### Read-Only

- `certificate_based_auth_properties` (Attributes) Configuration for certificate-based authentication used to authenticate SAML 2.0 identity provider users to Active Directory domain-joined streaming instances, if configured. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--certificate_based_auth_properties))
- `created_time` (String) The timestamp when the directory configuration was created, in RFC 3339 format.
- `id` (String) A synthetic identifier for the directory config, equal to the directory config name.
- `organizational_unit_distinguished_names` (Set of String) The distinguished names of the organizational units used for computer accounts in the directory.
- `service_account_credentials` (Attributes, Sensitive) The credentials for the service account used by AppStream fleets or image builders to join resources to the Active Directory domain. Credential values are sensitive and may not be returned by AWS. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--service_account_credentials))

<a id="nestedatt--certificate_based_auth_properties"></a>
### Nested Schema for `certificate_based_auth_properties`

Read-Only:

- `certificate_authority_arn` (String) The ARN of the AWS Certificate Manager Private Certificate Authority used for certificate-based authentication, if configured.
- `status` (String) The status of certificate-based authentication. Valid values are `DISABLED`, `ENABLED`, or `ENABLED_NO_DIRECTORY_LOGIN_FALLBACK`.


<a id="nestedatt--service_account_credentials"></a>
### Nested Schema for `service_account_credentials`

Read-Only:

- `account_name` (String, Sensitive) The user name of the service account used to join resources to the directory. This value is sensitive and may not be returned by AWS.
- `account_password` (String, Sensitive) The password of the service account used to join resources to the directory. This value is sensitive and is not returned by AWS.
